p: The prevalence of allergic diseases, including asthma and allergic rhinitis (AR), is increasing in Asian countries, especially in the elderly, 5 6 in which viral infections are major triggering factors. Although the initial starting point for COVID-19 appears to have been successful in controlling epidemics to the appropriate initial response in this region, there is constantly the possibility that a new virus subtype outbreak will begin. 7 8 Therefore, we report our consensus on how to manage allergic patients during this pandemic as well as how to protect HCWs.
